page.title: 10Sandringham Pheasantries
page.content:
Twelve keepers are employed to maintain and improve the habitat for the estate's game-birds. These birds, Pheasants, Partridges and ducks are truly wild since no birds have been reared since 1939. The keepers find nests and visit them daily to ensure that as many eggs as possible hatch successfully. In addition, they maintain hedges and copses, plant shrubs and clear the more dense undergrowth. Vermin is controlled, principally foxes and rabbits.
Shooting plays an important part on the estate and reaches its climax in January when The Court is in residence.
